snippet: Rates of heart attacks, strokes, kidney failure and amputations dropped over the past two decades, federal researchers said.
abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine reports that rates of heart attacks, strokes, kidney failure and amputations among diabetics have dropped by more than 60 percent from 1990 to 2010; attributes declines to better screening, medicines and care.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and DENISE GRADY

lead_paragraph: Rates of heart attacks, strokes, kidney failure and amputations dropped over the past two decades, federal researchers said.

headline.main: For Diabetics, Health Risks Fall Sharply
headline.print_headline: For Diabetics, Health Risks Fall Sharply

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
